de.nec.nle.siafu.model

Class Place

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.nec.nle.siafu.model.Place
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Overlayable, Trackable, Publishable

    public class Place
extends Object
implements Trackable, Publishable, Overlayable
    Places define a position in the simulated world. They can have their own properties, be used to create events (using the WorldModel) and become detinations for the agent's movements. Before you can use any Place instance, you will have to initialize it with the world, by running the initialize method. Ok, here's a catch: the gradients take a lot of space, so they are persisted using the PersistentCachedMap. If you keep the reference in a non temporary object, the Garbage Collector won't be able to destroy it, so don't. Never, ever, access temporary gradient (one with a relevant psition) or gradients directly. Use getGradient instead.
    Author:
    Miquel Martin

    • Constructor Detail

      • Place

        public Place(String type,
     Position pos,
     World world,
     Position relevantPosition)
        Create a Place. If relevantPosition is not null, we do not calculate a full distance gradient (i.e. the distance from anywhere in the map to this point), but a partial one, which stops calculating the moment it reaches relevantPosition. The place's name is created by concatenating the type and the position.
        Parameters:
        type - the type of place (e.g. office, airport, restroom)
        pos - the position of the place
        world - the world to which this place belongs
        relevantPosition - the position we care about for the purposes of gradient calculation

      • Place

        public Place(String type,
     Position pos,
     World world)
        Create a Place. The place's name is created by concatenating the type and the position.
        Parameters:
        type - the type of place (e.g. office, airport, restroom)
        pos - the position of the place
        world - the world to which this place belongs

      • Place

        public Place(String type,
     Position pos,
     World world,
     String name)
        Create a Place. If relevantPosition is not null, we do not calculate a full distance gradient (i.e. the distance from anywhere in the map to this point), but a partial one, which stops calculating the moment it reaches relevantPosition.
        Parameters:
        type - the type of place (e.g. office, airport, restroom)
        pos - the position of the place
        world - the world to which this place belongs
        name - the name of the place

      • Place

        public Place(FlatData flatData)
        Builds a Position as defined by a FlatData object. Internally, the latitude and longitude is converted to a row and column in the simulator's matrix.
        Parameters:
        flatData - the flat data string with the latitude and longitude

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        public static void initialize(World newWorld)
        Create the SiafuGradientCache that will hold the simulation places gradients. This must be run before you instantiate any Place.
        Parameters:
        newWorld - the world to which you initialize the places

      • getInfoKeys

        public Set<String> getInfoKeys()
        Return the keys of the info object. Note that this is not a static method as in Agent, because, unlike it, two Place instances can have different info fields.
        Returns:
        a Set with the info keys

      • getInfoValues

        public Collection<Publishable> getInfoValues()
        Get all the values for the objects mapped into the place's info field.
        Returns:
        the Collection of values for the place

      • fillCache

        public static void fillCache(int size)
        Request that the PersistentCachedMap that holds the place gradients be filled with the first size entries. This keeps the GUI from hicupping when a place is first used in the simulation.
        Parameters:
        size - the amount of elements to load from the persisted cache

      • getGradient

        public Gradient getGradient()
        Get the gradient to a place. The Gradient is a matrix with the distance from each map position to a central point. An agent can move towards that point by following the biggest descent all the way to the center.
        Returns:
        the gradient for this place

      • pointFrom

        public int pointFrom(Position targetPos)
        Returns the optimum direction to reach this place, from the given position. The path is calculated using a propagated distance gradient
        Parameters:
        targetPos - the position we intend to reach
        Returns:
        the optimal direction, represented by an int from 0 to 7, where 0 is North, and 7 is North-West, or -1 if we are there

      • pointFrom

        public int pointFrom(Position targetPos,
            int preferedDir)
        This method is identical to pointFrom(targetPos) except if several directions turn out to be equally good, the one given as priority is returned. If the prioritized one is not one of the optimal ones, it is ignored. This makes the agent walk a bit less drunken, turning only when they really need to.
        Parameters:
        targetPos - the position we intend to reach
        preferedDir - the preferred direction, if more than one is possible and this one is one of them
        Returns:
        the optimal direction, represented by an int from 0 to 7, where 0 is North, and 7 is North-West, or -1 if we are there

      • distanceFrom

        public int distanceFrom(Position targetPos)
        Return the distance from targetPos to this position. This distance is not calibrated to the map. May be it should...
        Parameters:
        targetPos - the position we want to calculate the distance to
        Returns:
        the distance, considering that one pixel is "10" and the diagonal step is 14.

      • flatten

        public FlatData flatten()
        Flatten out the Place object with the format: de.nec.nle.siafu.model.Place:name#type#latitude#longitude.
        Specified by:
        flatten in interface Publishable
        Returns:
        the FlatData object that represents this Place.

      • getContext

        public FlatData getContext(String ctxName)
                    throws UnknownContextException
        Returns a context variable in FlatData format. Notice that this does not only apply to the place's info data, but to anything on the simulation. With this method you can retrieve the following variables: The context variable can be one of three types:
        • The name of an overlay as defined in the simulation data
        • The name of one of the variables in the place's info field, defined at the agent model upon creation
        • A simulation intrinsec variable. These are called: Name, Time, and Position
        Specified by:
        getContext in interface Trackable
        Parameters:
        ctxName - the name of the variable
        Returns:
        a FlatData object representing the requested data
        Throws:
        UnknownContextException - if the context variable isn't known

        Returns:
        if the place is visible.

        Parameters:
        visible - set to true to make the place visible
